content: 6 round mandala drink coaster by sharlene introduction this fast and fun drink coaster project is my answer to something to share and give for christmas gifts i figured a set of four coasters in the same yarns and with a simple oscillation of colours for each round would look great and also be both stash friendly and economical the 6 row mandala takes almost no time to whip up with the longest part probably darning in the ends i worked in dk 8 ply acrylic yarns and used a 4 5mm hook but this project is super versatile so that you can play with hook size yarn weight and colour to your hearts content each of my coasters weighed around 10g of yarn aside from drink coaster/mug rugs this project lends itself to be used as christmas tree decorations a nice doyley set or perhaps join a bunch at the points for a festive table runner yarn requirements i used the australia craft store spotlight s 4 seasons marvel 8 ply acrylic yarn in balls of 100g for this pattern i have only worked the pattern in acrylic yarn but i feel confident it will turn out well in any yarn you choose the colours i have used for the four blue coaster set mint breakfast blue aqua teal royal blue twilight materials required 4 5mm hook yarn in your choice of colours darning needle for sewing in ends scissors stitch marker optional finished size diameter 14 5cm at widest point gauge not important abbreviations us terms chain = chain st s = stitches single_crochet = single_crochet double_crochet = double_crochet half_double_crochet = half_double_crochet tc = treble_crochet slip_stitch = slip_stitch sm = stitch marker instructions work in 1 strand of 8 ply with a 4 5mm hook use the photos as a suggested colour guide ch4 slip_stitch into 1st chain to form a circle row 1 chain 3 and work 11 double_crochet inside circle slip_stitch into top chain of 1st stitch 12 fasten_off and change colour row2 attach new colour chain 3 and place a second double_crochet into the same stitch place 2 double_crochet into each remaining stitch around row slip_stitch into top chain of 1st stitch 24 fasten_off and change colour row 3 attach new colour chain 3 2 double_crochet in next stitch * 1dc in next stitch 2dc in the following stitch* repeat to the end of the row slip_stitch into top chain of 1st stitch 36 fasten_off and change colour row 4 attach new colour chain 1 and single_crochet in the same stitch * skip 2 stitches then work 6 double_crochet in the next stitch skip a further 2 stitches and single_crochet * repeat to end of row slip_stitch into top chain of 1st stitch 36 fasten off and change colour note the pattern of single_crochet skip 2 6dc skip 2 is known as a shell fasten_off and change colour row 5 attach new colour chain 1 and single_crochet in the same stitch
